data.text:
The war in Ukraine has left millions of people in constant fear.

More than 3.7 million people have fled the country, but an estimated 13 million are stranded with no safe way out.  

Efforts to reach the country’s most vulnerable continue.
https://t.co/gO3wIGqrwX

Recognition
Justice
Development

On Friday's #RememberSlavery Day, find out about the International Decade for People of #AfricanDescent: https://t.co/BSRZ5TvAdO https://t.co/xq2vIUcP8R

UN staff members work in some of the most challenging & dangerous places in the world. 

On Friday's International Day of Solidarity, we honour and stand united with our colleagues who are detained or missing. https://t.co/miwlu3Pts2 https://t.co/QjE1NMXPeo

Friday's #RememberSlavery Day is an opportunity to demonstrate respect & understanding towards victims of slavery.

It also allows us to reinforce our determination to #FightRacism, which remains a legacy of one of the darkest chapters in human history. https://t.co/vOm3naXKyA https://t.co/2ePCEAyLBQ

Yemen: 7 years of war have resulted in one of the world's worst humanitarian crises.

Millions of people have been uprooted from their homes & are struggling to survive as the country teeters on the brink of a massive famine.

Learn how you can help: https://t.co/cXCgHmdSL0 https://t.co/9lxxq0wRB0

"Let us stand united against racism and together build societies based on dignity, equality and solidarity."

-- @antonioguterres on Friday's #RememberSlavery Day. https://t.co/vOm3naXKyA https://t.co/qbgYJLP8zG

Syria: 11 years of conflict has resulted in a humanitarian catastrophe.

On Thursday, the Security Council heard updates on the effort to draft a new constitution aimed at creating lasting peace & stability for the devastated country. https://t.co/mSL2f2NifR

The transatlantic slave trade ended centuries ago, but its shameful legacy of racism persists. 

On Friday's #RememberSlavery Day & always, we must #FightRacism & take a stand against discrimination & inequalities. https://t.co/vOm3naXKyA https://t.co/0kfigmOAnJ

The UN is working tirelessly to support people whose lives have been uprooted by the war in Ukraine. 

From delivering life-saving medical supplies to providing basic necessities like food & shelter, learn about our efforts. https://t.co/eX16Snw86a

140 in favor
    5 against
 38 abstentions

In an emergency session on the war in Ukraine, #UNGA overwhelming passes resolution demanding protection for civilians and improved humanitarian access. https://t.co/Mtn71tJj6T https://t.co/TFtavN5qT9

What we share online can have consequences in the real world.

Spreading misinformation can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & can put lives at risk during a crisis.

#PledgeToPause and verify facts before sharing. https://t.co/qFqoh7CZOA https://t.co/ltx7gJA0zJ

Stigmatizing people with tuberculosis can deprive them of the care they need. 

Stand against stigma & discrimination on Thursday's #WorldTBDay & every day. https://t.co/tNlc6t8q3H via @WHO #EndTB https://t.co/G0GBS8YVzl

On Thursday's International Day for the Right to Truth about Human Rights Abuses, we remember the victims and pay tribute to those who have devoted their lives to #StandUp4HumanRights. https://t.co/ybGA2MmPff https://t.co/gxNTeSk92k

Tuberculosis is one of the world’s deadliest infectious diseases.

On Thursday's #WorldTBDay, @WHO is calling attention to the persistent risks posed by this deadly respiratory illness.  https://t.co/tNlc6tq0Vf #EndTB https://t.co/D5HD7jVTrP
On Wednesday, both the General Assembly and the Security Council met on the war in Ukraine following the Russian invasion a month ago. https://t.co/l1TGbLwOid

Civilians and civilian infrastructure are #NotATarget. 

They must be protected. 

At all times. https://t.co/ZeA8rdUpRY

Ukraine: @WFP is working around the clock to deliver life-saving food assistance.

By ✈️,🚞 or 🚛, they are supporting people displaced inside Ukraine as well as those who have fled to neighbouring countries. https://t.co/aDSS3jl6hb

 https://t.co/u9nMXl8xOD

"The denial of education violates the human rights of women & girls." 

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet says all students in Afghanistan must be allowed to go back to school, following announcement that secondary schools for girls will remain closed. https://t.co/fZBCfrzlr2

"Early warning systems save lives.  
Let us ensure they are working for everyone."

-- @antonioguterres announces new plan to ensure everyone, everywhere, is protected by early warning systems to reduce disaster risk & support climate adaptation. https://t.co/NhqSmQVmVL

Children forced to flee their homes due to war face increased risks of exploitation and trafficking.

See what @UNICEF is doing to support and protect vulnerable children in and outside Ukraine. https://t.co/KA9opcxlqV

 https://t.co/N5PwW5tvI1

On Wednesday, #UNGA will resume its Emergency Special Session on the war in Ukraine. 

Get background information on special sessions here: https://t.co/ecRL3ATvks https://t.co/WA9ChQYMiC

The climate crisis has led to more extreme weather and destruction. 

Wednesday's #WorldMetDay spotlights the vital importance of early warning and early action for disaster risk reduction. https://t.co/ya9zvRTf2D https://t.co/fr1st0sk2J

From jobs 🎣 and food 🍣 to health care ingredients 💊 and habitats 🌊, the world's oceans provide a lot of our resources. 

The UN Ocean Conference in June will focus on solutions to #SaveOurOcean. https://t.co/GtO6NSFlvA

Improved weather forecasts, early warning systems & climate information could save thousands of lives & livelihoods per year.

More from @WMO on Wednesday's #WorldMetDay: https://t.co/ya9zvRTf2D https://t.co/rZARk4FWyi

Every child has the right to grow up free from fear.

The rights of children affected by violence must be safeguarded. 

@UNICEF is working to protect children in conflict zones around the world. 

They are #NotATarget! https://t.co/r39EMICFhH https://t.co/Bby8XenuP5

"It is time to end this absurd war."

Amid suffering, destruction & horror in Ukraine, @antonioguterres stresses that it's time to stop the fighting & give peace a chance. https://t.co/K7AA9fGgJb

As extreme weather events become more frequent & intense amid the climate crisis, early warning systems & #ClimateAction are crucial to save lives. 

More from @WMO on Wednesday's #WorldMetDay: https://t.co/ya9zvRBEb5 https://t.co/H7opw5DNaW

Four @WHO trucks carrying life-saving medicines have crossed the border from Poland to Ukraine to be distributed in the coming days.

More on what's being done to address the urgent health needs of those impacted by the war. https://t.co/TvTblcw1vi

 https://t.co/Cjs00Z1hAr
On Tuesday's #WorldWaterDay 💦, see how the #GlobalGoals focus on life under water to #SaveOurOceans: https://t.co/rrmZZRjMI8 🌊 https://t.co/MjglGdBOtK

"Continuing the war in Ukraine is morally unacceptable, politically indefensible and militarily nonsensical."

-- @antonioguterres says it is time to stop the fighting and give peace a chance. https://t.co/cNahp21Kxf https://t.co/KDp8jmF7ya

Yemen: 7 years of war have resulted in one of the world's worst humanitarian crises, with millions uprooted from their homes & struggling to survive.

UNCHR says more support is needed to deliver life-saving aid. https://t.co/IblksKW6cY via @Refugees
 https://t.co/lNMiI1KKSa

Groundwater is invisible, but its impact is everywhere.

Our drinking water, food supply & natural environment rely on groundwater.

Find out more from @FAO on Tuesday's #WorldWaterDay: https://t.co/f94NY5FUPd https://t.co/ADlNFQaR9e

Diversity is a strength, not a threat. 

Yet racism is a problem in every part of the world. 

During Racial Solidarity Week, @UNHumanRights explains how we can all speak out & #FightRacism & intolerance: https://t.co/Ijz1XWpOD8 https://t.co/bdCP7mDaXP

🚰 1 in 3 people live without safe drinking water.
💧 By 2025, half of the global population will be living in areas where water is scarce.

On Tuesday's #WorldWaterDay & every day, let's commit to protect this valuable resource! https://t.co/TblnsWKp1A https://t.co/Yf2XUoJGkR

From pregnant women to small children, the United Nations is working to support the most vulnerable whose lives have been uprooted by the war in Ukraine.

See how you can support our efforts to help those impacted by the suffering and destruction. https://t.co/eX16Snw86a

Groundwater accounts for 99% of the 🌍's freshwater.

This valuable resource provides critical benefits for people & ecosystems, and must be protected from pollution & exploitation. 

More in latest report from @UN_Water & @UNESCO: https://t.co/vy3bJUN2rn #WorldWaterDay https://t.co/1VnT4GZdJM

If we stand united against all forms of racism, hatred, prejudice & intolerance, we can break the silence that helps to maintain racial discrimination & oppression. 

Monday is #FightRacism Day. https://t.co/6AcOrzbITX #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/L8PPshRRKJ

Continued reliance on fossil fuels puts global economy & energy security at the mercy of geopolitical shocks & crises, @antonioguterres says, calling for rapid, just & sustainable energy transition & more ambitious #ClimateAction. https://t.co/2ECuvivccV https://t.co/En2Py5hSN0

In times of uncertainty & crises, poetry can provide comfort & inspiration. 

More from @UNESCO on Monday's #WorldPoetryDay: https://t.co/BULJw80Dl7 https://t.co/lMqM8OVodU

Forests are essential for planetary health and human well-being. 

They are also vital for sustaining food production.

On Monday's #IntlForestDay, learn more from @FAO about the importance of sustainable forestry. https://t.co/Y0sGoIZOZg https://t.co/ES2eavmZAM

"When we come to it 
We must confess that we are the possible 
We are the miraculous, we are the true wonder of this world
That is when, and only when 
We come to it."

"A Brave and Startling Truth", by Maya Angelou for UN's 50th anniversary. #WorldPoetryDay https://t.co/VnHnYdeSXG

Racism affects us all and impacts entire societies. 

But some groups suffer more than others.

On Monday's #FightRacism Day, learn how you can show solidarity with vulnerable groups. https://t.co/taxP3miHAy https://t.co/eroTLFUCej

Every action taken #ForNature counts.

On Monday's #IntlForestDay, learn about what's being done to help forests survive and thrive. https://t.co/WaVmPIlBAH https://t.co/rCeZsEFFBo

People with Down Syndrome must be able to meaningfully participate in decision-making on issues affecting their lives.

More on Monday's World Down Syndrome Day: https://t.co/GrH2Ol0tSF https://t.co/cuytJf6aGv

Every year, #Nowruz is celebrated as a day of hope & renewal.

During these uncertain time, our thoughts & solidarity are with all those marking this special day. https://t.co/5XHXxJi5QA https://t.co/V2h1zVZn7Z

Diversity is a strength, not a threat.
Yet racism is a problem in every country.

On Monday's #FightRacism day, see how you can take action and stand up for our common humanity:  https://t.co/PWxqEMAxTC https://t.co/BQ7hSMm0XO

Poems can provide comfort & inspiration in times of crisis and difficulty.

On Monday's #WorldPoetryDay, share a poem that has helped you during a difficult time. https://t.co/TU91eORUCV https://t.co/jqnpjsEbD5

From speaking up and engaging in constructive discussions to volunteering in support of vulnerable groups, we can all do our part to end racism & all forms of discrimination. 

See more ways to take action on Monday's #FightRacism Day: https://t.co/PWxqEMS8La https://t.co/OTms7aRp8l

As millions of people around the world flee violence, persecution, war or disaster, we can all stand #WithRefugees, wherever they may come from. 

UNHCR is working to help those in need. 

You can support their efforts: https://t.co/tlL4sEKG3p via @Refugees https://t.co/pipwwjEZKn

During these uncertain times, it's normal to feel fearful, sad, angry & anxious.

😴 Take care of yourself
📱 Learn to recognize misinformation
💛 Spread compassion

@UNICEF has more tips on how to cope when you feel overwhelmed. https://t.co/ubs5einjDb https://t.co/yiueXvL1eG

Now is the time for an unprecedented surge in investment in renewable energy, thereby creating jobs, saving money & lives.

#ClimateAction is not only the right thing to do, it's also the smart thing to do. https://t.co/U8OEgjpfmd https://t.co/Bs5ieLzTCW

During difficult times, it is normal to feel anxious, isolated or overwhelmed.

Improve your mental health by:
exercising🏃
eating well 🥗
getting enough sleep 😴

More tips from @WHO on Sunday's #HappinessDay: https://t.co/5fnexdHZoj https://t.co/hy5VvjlYl5

Impacts of the climate crisis are felt in every country. 

In Somalia, severe drought has decimated crops & livestock, resulting in the displacement of thousands of people. 

Here's what UNHCR is doing to help: 
https://t.co/gkBdJnRcCI via @Refugees

17.4 million people are food insecure in Yemen -- a situation that could worsen due to the war in Ukraine.

@WFP says immediate funding is needed to save lives. https://t.co/qvxWadspFH https://t.co/BgpIUsV6JQ

300 million people speak French around the world.

On Sunday's French Language Day, and every day, follow @ONU_fr to get updates on emerging crisis, the #GlobalGoals & more ... en français. https://t.co/JZVOWo9EKX

Prioritizing mental health is important during times of high stress.

Find moments of happiness by relaxing, practicing mindfulness and connecting with friends & family.

More on Sunday's #HappinessDay: https://t.co/Vn0cc7GwCO https://t.co/IbOnbs9Qzp

More than 3 million people have now fled Ukraine to seek safety – the vast majority are women and children. 

They are particularly vulnerable to the risk of human trafficking.

See what UNHCR is doing to help #EndHumanTrafficking: https://t.co/OHnVIvnxUb via @refugees https://t.co/v5gZ6wrmIg

Every child has the right to grow up free from fear.

The rights of children affected by violence must be safeguarded. 

@UNICEF is working to protect children in conflict zones around the world. 

They are #NotATarget! https://t.co/r39EMIUgGh https://t.co/KGGJ9QcKeY

Meet the women working with @WFP_UNHAS in Afghanistan.

Despite increasing challenges, they remain committed to helping humanitarian staff & vital supplies reach people in need in every corner of the country. 

More about the UN Humanitarian Air Service: https://t.co/IUvfCvcncM https://t.co/Nvoaf1LbDM

Women and girls around the 🌎 are #ClimateAction leaders.

They are helping to address underlying inequalities & supporting communities as they transition to greener economies to build a more sustainable future for all. 

https://t.co/LKI1J6EIb5 via @UNDP https://t.co/WRlWWSV54n

The Russian invasion of Ukraine has created a dire humanitarian & refugee crisis. 

See how you can stay informed & support those impacted by the suffering & destruction. https://t.co/cs4XHAMymI

"Realizing the vision of a world free of racism & racial discrimination demands action every day, at every level, in every society."

-- @antonioguterres at #UNGA event ahead of Monday's #FightRacism Day. https://t.co/aHbIHupOaQ https://t.co/CedZiqhEem

Ukraine: 40+ attacks on healthcare, including on staff, patients & facilities have taken place since the war began. 

Without safe access for humanitarian support, people could face dire & potentially fatal shortages of food, water & medicine. #NotATarget https://t.co/ItNrX4zamX

"Every bit of warming matters. 
 Every year matters. 
 Every choice matters. 
 And every action matters."

@KHayhoe & @SelwinHart join a @NetflixFilm panel discussion with @JohnKerry, @GhostPanther & @xiyebastida on the importance of #ClimateAction. https://t.co/toDgJlIq8T https://t.co/iafeIk3BVP

"The United Nations is not aware of any biological weapons programmes."

-- @UN_Disarmament chief @INakamitsu tells Security Council meeting on Threats to International Peace & Security, regarding the situation in Ukraine.
https://t.co/hUhbD1zeBc

On Friday, UN & partners in Ukraine completed 1st convoy of urgent humanitarian aid to Sumy, one of the most war-affected areas. 

The 130 metric tons of essential aid included medical supplies, bottled water & food that will help some 35,000 people. https://t.co/bQzRwm2VSb

Ukraine: As millions of vulnerable people flee the war, @UNmigration warns of an increased risk of human trafficking as well as sexual exploitation & abuse.

Read about what's being done to protect people on the move. https://t.co/TBmWxQCkHo

Hour by hour, minute by minute, people are fleeing the terrifying reality of the war in Ukraine.

Unless the conflict ends, this heartbreaking crisis will only get worse.

The people of Ukraine need peace -- now.
 
You can help support @Refugees here: 
https://t.co/wZR5NdAic3 https://t.co/82YUBJNN4X

Global #COVID19 cases are again on the rise, warns @WHO. 

Misinformation that the pandemic is over, the lifting of mask mandates & physical distancing requirements & a more transmissible Omicron sub-variant are fueling the uptick. https://t.co/uuHn3K7TlN

From inequality to hunger to poverty - the hopes, dreams, lives and livelihoods of millions are at stake. 

@antonioguterres outlines his five priorities for the world's Least Developed Countries. https://t.co/a8pM3EcCeO

"There must be a meaningful sustained political process to enable a peaceful settlement. 

The lives of millions of Ukrainians & the peace & security of the entire region & possibly beyond, depend on it."

-- @DiCarloRosemary briefing the Security Council. https://t.co/0hovMiIkuL

For 76 years, the @CIJ_ICJ has served as the UN's principal judicial body, settling legal disputes between countries.

Judgments delivered by the Court are binding upon the parties concerned. 

More about the Court: https://t.co/EkVTjAXZPv https://t.co/3Z8Y2WRA7L

Donors have pledged nearly $1.3 billion to support Yemen's urgent humanitarian needs.

After more than 7 years of conflict, the country is decimated & on the brink of a massive famine. 

You too can donate to help save lives in Yemen: https://t.co/cXCgHmvu9A

Babies are #NotATarget. 

Children are #NotATarget. 

Civilians are #NotATarget. 

Hospitals are #NotATarget.

Health care workers are #NotATarget. 

Schools are #NotATarget. 

Humanitarians are #NotATarget. https://t.co/VVhacn9bIp

In the last 6 years, 455 journalists have been killed while carrying out their work.

Attacks on journalists are attacks on freedom of expression. 

Now, more than ever, we must ensure journalists are protected. https://t.co/SBbz7G6zFS via @UNESCO https://t.co/L8dyJflJjn

Fossil fuels account for 75% of greenhouse gas emissions & 90% of carbon dioxide emissions, making them the largest contributor to the climate crisis. 

As our world warms faster than ever, here's more about the causes & impacts of the climate emergency: https://t.co/0cayuJs0pg https://t.co/4XKHKmRGBm

The war in Ukraine could create a devastating freefall into poverty for millions of people.

Early projections from @UNDP show up to 90% of Ukrainians could face poverty and extreme economic vulnerability due to the conflict. https://t.co/Hsb2VKpvJj

UN political chief @DicarloRosemary urges Security Council to call for responsible leadership by Libyan institutions & to remain united in support of UN efforts to assist Libya in its path to becoming a peaceful & stable country. https://t.co/rQmSzWDUoy https://t.co/wd2clwHQX4

"We need peace.

 Peace for the people of Ukraine.

 Peace for the world. 

 We need peace now."

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/J04zzaTbPK https://t.co/5UtpTVTRgd
.@CIJ_ICJ rules that Russian Federation must immediately suspend the military operations in Ukraine. https://t.co/6fDHPfILxU

Afghanistan: With a staggering 95% of people not getting enough to eat, food insecurity & malnutrition threaten an entire generation, warns UN humanitarian coordinator in the country. https://t.co/QOqAsqb7cC

🔹 Consent of the parties
🔹 Impartiality
🔹 Non-use of force except in self-defence & for protecting civilians

These three principles guide the deployment of @UNPeacekeeping operations. 

Details: https://t.co/8euWunN44Q https://t.co/IA3V5kMOq0

As millions of people around the world flee violence, persecution, war or disaster, we can all stand #WithRefugees, wherever they may come from. 

UNHCR is working to help those in need. 

You can support their efforts: https://t.co/tlL4sEKG3p via @Refugees https://t.co/ywCfABhMSP

Yemen: Seven years of war have destroyed lives & resulted in untold suffering.

On Wednesday, the UN, donors & partners will come together to seek support for the humanitarian response that provides vital aid to millions of Yemenis. https://t.co/GeiDXCF0mU #YemenCantWait https://t.co/7blLWj4QJS

As the Commission on Narcotic Drugs is underway, find out about the UN's work to protect people's health & well-being by supporting countries in addressing the world drug problem. https://t.co/HgNhNmP1kk via @UNODC https://t.co/DWHnNcl3NQ

Myanmar: Serious human rights abuses, including the targeting of civilians, may amount to war crimes & crimes against humanity.

@UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet urges the international community to help end the crisis & hold perpetrators accountable. https://t.co/1dEDXnsEz0

#UNGA proclaims 15 March the International Day to Combat Islamophobia.

General Assembly calls for strengthened international efforts to foster global dialogue on promotion of culture of tolerance & peace, based on respect for human rights & for diversity of religions & beliefs. https://t.co/DTf2dLYNeB

A Ukrainian child has become a refugee almost every single second since the start of the war.

They need peace now.

https://t.co/VB1z5b1wzl via @UNICEF https://t.co/qb7AQQ0F6h

The UN has issued a new report on special measures taken to strengthen the prevention of and response to sexual exploitation and abuse. 

Ensuring victims' rights and dignity continue to be at the forefront of all efforts. https://t.co/BC4qQpWgFg https://t.co/FJVpgc0l5q

3 million people have fled Ukraine, many only with the few items they could carry. 

Here are 5 ways you can help refugees right now. 
https://t.co/Qn6PXFriv8 via @Refugees

 https://t.co/JLq98BDeIN

"Further escalation of the war, whether by accident or design, threatens all of humanity."
@antonioguterres reiterates his call for an immediate end of hostilities in Ukraine. https://t.co/J04zzaBAYc https://t.co/e9CjPHpfNO

Ukraine: Health facilities are stretched to the breaking point @WHO warns, while working to urgently provide aid. 

Supply chains are severely disrupted, medicine stocks are running low & hospitals are struggling to provide care to the sick & wounded.

https://t.co/MnOYCXeJQk

People around the world are calling for greater access to accurate & reliable information.

@UNESCO works to promote freedom of expression, media independence and the right to information. https://t.co/gi2N5SiVVW https://t.co/pog20ygVQM

"To forge the sustainable future we need, women and girls must be front and centre, leading the way."

-- @antonioguterres at opening of annual session of the Commission on the Status of Women. #CSW66 https://t.co/zHc115ZbOw
